intro: Eleutherococcus divaricatus, commonly known as the Siberian ginseng, is a deciduous shrub native to the forests of eastern Russia, China, and Korea. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, white to yellowish flowers. The plant produces red berries that are rich in antioxidants and have been used in traditional medicine. Eleutherococcus divaricatus is valued for its adaptogenic properties, which help the body resist stress. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
